text: We will do the testing after Optimus

Hey <!channel>, with our subscription with Notion coming to an end, its time to move all of our documentation to a google drive folder. I've cleared out the basic redundant information and organized the folders. But I don't have enough company knowledge to manage all the files on my own so the tasks are gonna be delegated based on each person's department.

*Who and what?*
Each person is delegated one folder on the Offcourse Google Drive folder to manage the file transfer.
<@U177W7XH8> - Subsidies, Grants & Applications
<@U0D6EPESC> - Software Development
<@UBE37B8JX> - MarCom
<@U177W7XH8> - Finance
<@U0D6EPESC> - Legal
<@U9GR3G88Y> - Design
<@U8AM0S37E> - Business Development

*What you need to do?*
1. Move redundant, irrelevant information to the folder 'Archive'. Only If you're certain that it can be deleted, go ahead and delete it.
2. Create necessary sub-folders that you think you or the rest of your team will need.
3.  Move all your documentation from Notion/Personal drives to the Offcourse Google Drive under their respective folders. It is VERY important to move your current work spaces/documents from your personal drives to the shared Offcourse one to ensure that we actually use the Drive folder when we work.

*By when to do it?*
To make sure that all of us have our files transferred ASAP, it would be best if everyone who's been assigned a folder above can finish the final preparations on their folders for the file transfer by Monday, 19th November.

*Link to Offcourse drive folder*
<https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-pC7Pi8mtjNm8yRG5iRHplZVk>

Cheers! :raised_hands:

Sure <@U0D6EPESC> So cool the new version is already at <http://offcourse.io|offcourse.io>. It looks really good :slightly_smiling_face: I was saying to Loek we should show Ultimaker the before and after shots, as you can really tell a big difference!
Oh yes, I also messed up the scrolling on about and FAQ, but these are easily fixed...
After they are done (at least the second one) we can officially launch

Platform is almost there... But two very nasty bugs remain. One is search sometimes fucks up, the other is that forms don't scroll on mobile... Any help with these tomorrow (just thinking along with me will do...) is highly appreciated.

Prolly most of you guys already know, but wednesday is an amazing day; Offcourse launch 2.0 day! :tada: We will start in the morning and will work full day to make sure that everything is settled, all the media is up to date, everyone is nicely informed, etc. etc., so <@U0D6EPESC> is going to get pizza for everyone. Possibly this will go on until a bit after dinner but since we got pizza in the tummies we are good to go anyway! So excited and see you guys next week :male-astronaut::skin-tone-2:

Hey guys, I'm feeling a bit under the weather today so probably not gonna come in. I will be at home and online though, so any tasks like either the drafting the guest lists that <@UBE37B8JX> delegated or anything else, I will work on them from home.
Here's the document with notes from today's product testing <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vwA2gyb4Kn1Zs7MYBjLmlfYbjyr8E7fL1zODwlR2dcE/edit?ts=5be300e6>

-Revise text and format

“Get to know Offcourse!” Course Card- created by Loek

PLATFORM RELAUNCH — Next week Wednesday 14th Nov
Need to outline programme of the day I.e. party, platform release

MARKETING/CONTENT (Nat- <@UC46W9E77>)
—> Focus on interaction through the Offcourse twitter! This is should be the main channel- open, visible interactions: no dms or emails
—> Make cards when possible and use this a conversation starter— “perhaps this could be forked/ or better modified/refined?”

“OFFCOURSE TABLE WORKSHOPS” -(kitchen table coders)
—> Review topics
— Plan for first session/workshop — provisioned date 28th November 2018
- Create marketing content (review Waag)- buzz question, raffle- first 8 sign-ups (eventbrite?), visual content (see with Loek if needed)
- Outline programme and participants- Due Friday- via slack

Hey guys, I won't be coming to the office today. I caught a cold end last week and I don't feel so well at the moment. If anything, I will be online and will keep time for the beat-testing at noon.

Hey guys, just a reminder that tomorrow there's another platform testing session at 12. Make sure to have a course prepared to put on the platform. Here's a couple of links that might be interesting to explore further in making a course. <https://twitter.com/slszone> (perhaps a card on serverless?) <http://bradfrost.com/blog/post/deep-work-update/> (perhaps a card on productivity and time management, and how that can be made possible with certain applications etc)

attachments.title: Deep Work Update
attachments.text: Last week I made the decision to schedule every minute of my day, and wanted to share a quick update. In short, this is working out very well for me so far. A few accomplishments: I coded every day - This might not sound like a big deal but there are so many times my job pulls me really

And if you need more "designed" slides, or add graphics, photos and icons, you can ask for my help.

If you don't know how to use Adobe InDesign yet, check out James' card about it ! :tada: Else, Adobe has got quite some good basic tutorials on their website. (This is how I learned it as well :slightly_smiling_face: )

In the Drive in the folder Branding, I have uploaded three files for Offcourse presentations, one being a template for slides and the other two an example of how slides could look like (in PDF and as a package for editing). It is very important that, whenever we present Offcourse externally, to have a same visual coherence in our presentations. <@U8AM0S37E> and I decided to use Adobe InDesign for now as our standard software to make presentations in, since it is the industry standard for document editing and gives us quite some space for design, yet is also fairly quick to learn (the basics).

<!channel> i've just pushed a version with search included to <http://beta.offcourse.io|beta.offcourse.io>. This version contains all the versions that I want to ship with the 1.0 release of Offcourse around the 1st of November, and the one I'd like to test with all of you next Tuesday after lunch (13:00 - 14:00). After the testing session, I want to take +/- 30min. to come up with two lists: one for bugs, the other for improvements (styling, ui/ux, not new features) and prioritize them so that I not what needs to be finished before we think Offcourse is ready to ship its 1.0 release (:tada::tada::tada:)
